intro: Chaetanthera moenchioides var. sulphurea, commonly known as the sulphur chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that resemble small bells. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, and it produces small, fragrant blooms throughout the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
